item.title: AHCTF2021: NameCheck
item.description: For the birds ðŸ”— It has been a while since I have blogged. The importance of doing so has not been absent only outweighed by the inertia(that dread to begin). This is the start of an attempt to put more of my thoughts on e-paper. I also maintain a telegram space where I dump materials/resources I encounter as I go along. Checksec ðŸ”—[*] '/home/levanto/Documents/Return-To-ROP/ChasingFlags/AHCTF/finals/namecheck' Arch: i386-32-little RELRO: Partial RELRO Stack: No canary found NX: NX disabled PIE: No PIE (0x8048000) RWX: Has RWX segments .

item.title: AH19CTF WriteUps: Command Parser
item.description: What’s provided: ðŸ”— Server access to a directory containing an executable and a flag file. You cannot just cat flag because r--r----- 1 commandparserctf-pwn root ... flag and of course, your whoami profile is not in the sudoers list. A link to download the executable file. This is good. You can dissassemble it later. Let’s get cracking :D ðŸ”—Your first step is to run the executable and have a clue of what it does.
